books.title: Vikram and the Vampire
books.author: Richard F. Burton
books.summary: King Vikram becomes trapped in a cycle of stories as he tries to capture a cunning vampire.

books.title: The League of the Scarlet Pimpernel
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A collection of short stories featuring the Scarlet Pimpernel.

books.title: Our Nig
books.author: Harriet E. Wilson
books.summary: An autobiographical account of a young biracial girl abandoned by her parents and forced into servitude in the northern United States.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Treasure Island
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A young boy finds adventure on the high seas as he battles bloodthirsty pirates in search of a long-lost treasure.

books.title: Getting Married
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: On the morning of a young couple’s wedding, concerns about what is to come inspire discussions about the institution of marriage.

books.title: Man and Superman
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Jack Tanner flees both London and responsibility when he is made guardian of his childhood friend Ann Whitehead.

books.title: Phantastes
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: A young man awakes in Fairy Land, where he takes part in a series of strange adventures.

books.title: The Sport of the Gods
books.author: Paul Laurence Dunbar
books.summary: In a Southern town and then in New York City, an African American family struggles for for its integrity and survival.

books.title: The Three Impostors
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: Two flâneurs in Victorian London get caught up with the members of a secret society and their search for a rare Roman coin.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: A Study in Scarlet
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The self-declared world’s first consulting detective unravels a mysterious case of murder and revenge.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: The Theory of Moral Sentiments
books.author: Adam Smith
books.summary: Adam Smith assesses the sources of human morality and the role of human sympathies in judging the propriety of our actions and behaviors.

books.title: Hudibras
books.author: Samuel Butler
books.summary: A knight and his squire set forth for adventure and love.

books.title: Point Counter Point
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: Several connected stories are interwoven to create a satirical look at English society.

books.title: The Time Machine
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: A mysterious inventor travels to a land far off in time.

books.title: The Wisdom of Father Brown
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: Amateur detective and Catholic priest Father Brown solves mysteries in this second collection of Father Brown short stories.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: On a Chinese Screen
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A collection of short vignettes about the people and places W. Somerset Maugham encountered during his travels along the Yangtze River in 1919–20.
